alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:16PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cumberland County through 145 PM CDT... At 116 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crossville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Fairfield Glade, Crab Orchard, Lake Tansi, Cumberland Mountain State Park and Slate Springs. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 317 and 330. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
